page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO HARVEL
page.content: Harvel is a hamlet of some 250 people in the parish of Meopham and the district of Gravesham in Kent. From being mainly agricultural it has come into the commuter belt and is within easy reach of the M2, M20 and M25/26. The network of footpaths, bridleways and tracks attracts walkers and horse riders and there are several areas with spectacular views which are visited by tourists. There is a small light engineering works in the centre of the village which brings employment Necessary services are within reach but residents need their own transport as bus services are minimal. The area has planning restrictions which protect it from exploitation by developers, and residents and visitors alike appreciate the peaceful rural atmosphere of Harvel.
